title: Great except for one problem
comment: Subpages don't work and cause the app to crash to search bar. Other than that pretty good!

title: I miss what it used to be.
comment: This is still my favorite way to browse tropes, but it doesn't let me see what trope I'm reading about, and most larger tropes that have branching example pages refuse to load many of said pages.

title: Great but for subpages...
comment: I love the app when it works. Sadly the subpage don't work with the latest version...

title: Subpages not working
comment: I cannot access the Subpages. Every time I try to click on one for any page,  Lampshade shuts down. I have to access them via search.

I like that it works with the new site.  2 things,  though: the links usually found at the bottom of the page aren't there (the ones that link to the next/previous article in a particular trope "section"), and the bar at the top no longer displays the trope name. Good work anyway,  though.

title: Thanks for the update!!
comment: Switched to Android Troper for a few weeks since the update, but it just wasn't the same. Glad to have lampshade back!!

title: Useless
comment: This app is literally just the website except slower.
Right now, lampshade has a serious loading problem.

title: Problem!
comment: After new update i cant load the pages at all!! What happen??
It was working a couple of days ago, now it doesn't.

title: Problem with the new website
comment: It was an easy 4/5 before and best TV Tropes app, but needs to be updated to function properly for the new site, stability, Material Design and forum function.

title: What is it doing?
comment: Perhaps it is playing up some obscure trope for the lulz, definitely not what it says on the tin. YMMV. Plus a third thing.
Once you've got the hang of the interface, it's really good!

title: Thank You
comment: Love this app I have both tvtrope apps and use them both. People that gave it low scores where can I download your tropes app...?

title: Fun app
comment: When I have to act like I know what I'm talking about with a subject, I refer here and no one can tell the difference. Yes I know my friends can see this.

title: Need tweaks but over all excellent.
comment: The latest update is nice. The theme changing is great for oleds but the tablet mode needs a switch to be able to turn it off.

title: Not loading
comment: No pages are loading, not random and also not from the search. Looks interesting but can't get it to actually work... I understand now that this is a problem caused by the website. However, reinstalling didn't fix this issue for me.

title: Buggy at best
comment: On the rare occasions this app works correctly, it is beyond compare. For the other 75% of the time, it's broken. Unfortunately, the only alternative is even worse.

title: Really good
comment: I don't know who spent this much time making an app exclusively for TV Tropes, but its the best at what it does.

title: Looks like.. .
comment: They broke the parsing again. Useful app nonetheless .

title: Beat app for viewing TV Tropes
comment: I love this app. Great interface. Very easy. The S Pen, Air View hover to uncover spoiler feature is a really really nice touch as well. I wish more people would implement this. One thing I would like to see is compatibility with Samsung's Multiview feature. Keep up the good work.

title: Great!
comment: Anything that makes one of my favorite sites, TV Tropes, easier to use on my Kyocera Event cell is worth five stars.

title: Android Troper is much better
comment: I used this one because it was the best available at the time. However it's often buggy, crashes and doesn't display the pages properly. Android Troper is much better.

title: Hey man
comment: Thanks for this awesome app!

title: Great app! :(
comment: Easy to use, and better than the site for mobile use. I like the "recently read" feature

title: Great little app
comment: Allows you to easily view tvtropes articles in a handy and intuitive way. More than just a simple wrapper for the site.

title: Awesome developer
comment: Was broken. Filed a bug. Fixed next day. Killer app for me for cultural and sociological research. Thanks!

title: Small problem
comment: I can't go directly to a page when I press on a saved article.

title: Awesome App
comment: Drains all of my spare time on a regular basis. Love it.

title: Galaxy S II
comment: Usually works awesomely and is my number one time-waster, but it does go down from time to time. I understand that thus its generally from the website, but from an end user standpoint it is very annoying to have all of your saved pages erased.

title: I knee something was
comment: It's stopped working again. None of the articles load.

title: TV tropes companion
comment: Easily one of the most useful and thought out interface to navigate TV tropes on android. There's even a dark theme in the settings!

title: Can't search
comment: Hey, I can't search anything, the search won't Halen if I press the enter key on my touch keyboard, I have a Droid Incredible. Please fix! This app looks really cool and I would like to use it!!

title: Love
comment: Love it.

title: No more fav tropes!
comment: Okay. Pages are loading again but all my favorites are gone. Is there anyway to get them back? :(

title: Brilliant
comment: The best tvtropes app out there, except for occasional crashing when the back button is used

title: Great, but
comment: Not loading articles recently  Edit:Fixed :D

title: Excellent
comment: This app is perfect for reading tropes, especially with the dark theme. The recent update has fixed the loading issue. Works great again!

title: Updated soon, pages still won't load
comment: I've updated the soon the moment I enter the app store, but the pages still won't load. Please look into it ASAP.

title: Favorite
comment: Working great again!

title: Works great now!
comment: This has always been the best app for TVTropes, but it has really been proven now. The site broke the app, but the dev fixed it within a day or so of it becoming apparent. Thanks dev!

title: Love getting my trope fix on the go!
comment: Awesome app! Love it!

title: Best Trope App.
comment: This is probably the best app of tropes in the store. One thing that could possibly make it even better is if it was possible to sign in and edit pages. Still though, great app.

title: Excellent
comment: Even though there are a few quirks, this app follows the android design guidelines quite nicely, which is awesome.

title: Good.
comment: I just wish that it could handle the pop-in text footnotes.
Very nice program, the icing on the cake would be a save-page function and an exit button.

title: I love you
comment: Was looking for an app like this ever since DroidTropes stopped existing. Thank you!!

title: Used to be great
comment: Now it went open pages. Don't bother with this app.

title: Sick app
comment: Great job

title: Excellent
comment: It's just like having tvtropes.

title: Night mode would be terrific
comment: Especially for us, those with amoled screens.

title: There goes the rest of my life
comment: Very convenient interface to a hopelessly addictive trove of information.

title: Solid concept
comment: An app for viewing TV Tropes is a great idea that someone should have thought of a long time ago. With a bit more functionality this app will be perfect. I would love to be able to get known and edit articles on it, too.

title: Flawless!
comment: Excellent app! May want to add a modestly priced "Lampshade Pro" for tropers that want to edit entries on their smartphones.

title: meh...
comment: Hopefully more bugfixes are coming soon. Without the ability to unmark spoilers when you want, this is nearly useless, plus the search is super wonky. I can still get DroidTropes from Amazon so that's what I'll use. At least it's working at this point.

title: Xperia U
comment: Searching comes up with nothing, and this isn't because of lack of articles. Also, the extremely long articles that have been subdivided aren't readable.

title: Meh
comment: Worked in the beginning, now it refuses to open every other page.

title: Yes! I'm never leaving the house!
comment: Great resources & Excellent updates!!! Thank you!

title: Good app
comment: As an avid reader of tvtropes this app succeeds in giving me my trope fix and delivering said fix in a very streamlined manner; however I do have a few pointers: as mentioned before, the spoiler toggle tends to make the app unstable and crash a lot. This is a bit inconvenient.  Also, I have two phones and a tablet running the app, synching faves/saved articles between devices would be great.

title: Perfect
comment: High quality software

title: What go button?
comment: I understand that you need to hit the go button to do a search. But you see, THERE IS NO GO BUTTON TO HIT. The screen shot doesn't accurately display what is seen in the app, so I can't search at all. No bueno.

title: Good but still not working properly
comment: The "find" option crashes the app. Search option doesn't work when you hit enter. But random is cool I suppose.

title: Bug Report
comment: After a while of reading the app will refuse to open a link and sometimes has issues with link accuracy (the selection box won't appear over the link)  When you select "toggle spoilers" the app will not load pages until uninstalled and then re-installed. Lastly the search bar does not respond when you press enter. Other than that this app succeeds where others have failed

title: Pretty good app
comment: I like it a lot; in fact, I like the treatment of spoilers better than the full website. I wish there were some way to open multiple pages at a time, though. I would give this app a 5 star rating, except for the fact that the search hangs every time. I have to force close the app to get it to respond again.

title: Love it so far!
comment: Loove tv tropes and this app has been good so far! Thank you!
Great solution for all your trope needs!

title: It Just works.
comment: Love this app.

title: Almost perfect...
comment: For the most part, I love it. The layout it great, as are the skinning options. Simply beautiful. However, I do have a few issues to point out: 1. Parsing seems oddly slow at times, even on perfectly stable connections. 2. There should be an option to prevent saved pages from automatically disappearing from their list once they have been read. 3. The search bar doesn't automatically initiate a search upon hitting Enter. Also, I'm slightly confused as to whether the saved pages are actually saved to phone storage, i.e. if they are available for offline reading. Gotta try that one out. But overall, great job. Just fix the issues I mentioned, it's going to be perfect.
Just what I needed
Perfect :)

title: It has all the content of TVTropes.
comment: So, everything you need!

title: Excellent replacement for the old Droidtropes app.
comment: The only thing I'd suggest is adding an option where tapping a link once displays a trope name, and tapping it twice actually follows the link.
